data.title: Adding a new output to GBuffer
Why don't make an internal editor?
data.body:
Really an internal Editor like how Stingray/CocosCreator have, when you click on script it is popued and you can edit it. How Godot and Atomic have is also good, but the "pop-uped" version is better.
Really, visual studio/monodevelop are slow, SharpDevelop is ok, visual studio code better. But have an internal editor would be REALLY perfect. Take in consideration this man! Thanks for all your works :)

Sorry for my english i'm studying for improve it.

I'm not sure if its something I'm missing as it seems the shaders need to be compiled into .asset files

data.title: Fatal Error on new project creation
data.body:
Running BansheeEditorExec.exe from prebuilt binaries v0.4, v0.4p1 and creating a new project results in InternalErrorException. I have included two screens. You can access an archive containing the .html and .dmp files [here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/ewnjwjerg68jnfw/20161126_1337.7z?dl=0).

I am running Windows 10 x64. I received 0.4p1 from [here](https://github.com/BearishSun/BansheeEngine/issues/49). I was tracing down that issue on startup initially.

Please let me know if I can be of any assistance.

![20161126 - fatalerror](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12578432/20642528/168810ee-b3df-11e6-971d-b7c10a78a2ae.png)
![20161126 - stacktrace](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12578432/20642527/1642cdd6-b3df-11e6-98f7-874e3fc56271.png)

data.title: Fix editor crash on creating GUI Widget component
data.body: Fixes crash on editor which occurs on creating a GUI widget component (Components > GUI widget)

data.title: Linux
data.body:
Hi Marko!

In this pull request, you can find a `FileSystem` implementation on Linux (and probably OS X), as well as some automatic tests for `FileSystem`.

(Disclaimer: I played a little bit with Windows-specific code to factorize things, but I did not build it so there are probably typos (best case), or mistakes (worse case!). So don't hesitate to look closely at those sections :-).)

I also implemented `CrashHandler`'s methods (with, again, some untested Windows-specific code fiddling), and there are a couple of compilation fixes and relatively small edits.

Of course, any kind of feedback is welcome.

Marc

Simply click on the banshee application on the taskbar.

data.title: Dock Assertion
data.body:
Had some time today to break the editor some more. 
When you move the dock from it's default position and let go in between the viewport and one of the docks. It will move the dock in the same place as the library dock right on top of it. 

To Repeat Bug.
Drag and drop a dock in between the viewport and another dock. 
Try to click on the library dock that seems like it's fused with the dock moved.

data.title: Banshee assert failed and projects not compiling (source preview commit b47a79b)
data.body:
I've used OpenGL and OpenAudio in CMake options, tried to build engine by myself, it launched with build errors (see Compilation log down below), but there is assertion error appeared right on startup (Line 612). Reason: result of getting parameter index is InvalidType, possibly because I used OpenGL.
![assertionfailescreenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15637319/19040324/08620c7a-899d-11e6-90c2-c37fc32c2964.png)

[Compilation log](https://github.com/BearishSun/BansheeEngine/files/506403/Output.txt)

data.title: [future enhancement] migrate to C++17 Filesystem library
data.body:
Currently Banshee doesn't build on Linux, and part of this is because it uses some own `WString` class and tries to use `std::fstream::open` with `const wchar_t *` which is Windows-only feature (**not** C++  #standard). As far as I know using `const char *` is Unicode-working on Linux (and probably on OS X too), so maybe putting some #ifdefs there will help, but in general it would be nice to migrate to C++17 Filesystem library which is Unicode-aware:

http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/filesystem/path

Clang 3.9 is needed for that. It would also build with GCC since GCC 5.3. The only quirk is it needs to be linked with `-stdlib=libc++` or `-lstdc++fs`.

Also, I've heard that it's supported by VS already (I don't have VS to check).

data.title: fix Clang build
data.body:
According to C++ std std::chrono::high_resolution_clock is alias,
and in VS it's alias for steady_clock,
and in Clang it's alias for system_clock.

So to avoid problems I've changed BsTimer code to use
`std::chrono::high_resolution_clock` instead of
specialized variable type.

data.title: Tolerate a passed null pointer for the interface "BansheeEngine::bs_delete"?
data.body:
- How do you think about to support an approach that [a template function like "`bs_delete`"](https://github.com/BearishSun/BansheeEngine/blob/7c1b1c1d03e7f42a02bcd6575a0b579f9fc9b4c8/Source/BansheeUtility/Include/BsMemoryAllocator.h#L262) can also tolerate a passed null pointer?
- Would you like to avoid any extra checks at [other source code places](http://docs.banshee3d.com/Native/group___memory.html#gab7f1d8bc0be937b506afc5caae288b1f) then?

data.title: Binaries release doesn't work.
data.body:
0.3 run perfectly on my Windows 7 system. 0.4 not. it shows "D3dcompiler_47.dll not found". But when i download it from this site "https://www.dll-files.com/d3dcompiler_47.dll.html" i get these problem :
with the 64bit version it shows "problem with api-ms-core-stencyh-l1-2.0.dll"
with the 32bit (10...) it simply won't start.
with the other two 32bit version it is uploaded for a moment in ram and after 1sec closed, without shows for any moment the editor.
My specs are:
i7 4790k
r9 270x Toxic
Maximus VII Ranger
16gb 1600mhz ddr3
windows 7 ultimate
i have all visual c++ redistributable.
directx 11 (checked with dxdiag)
what's the problem? I want to run the new version with skeletal animation!

data.title: Use TBB
data.body: Hello, why you do not want to use Intel TBB, as MemoryAllocator? I think it will give you many benefits as using the memory pool from the same package. Yet to my knowledge, have intel mkl to work with matrices and numbers ..

data.title: Problem with Encoding
Enable parallel build in Release MSVC
data.body:
Add /MP flag for Release since we're not using incremental rebuild. 
This should make compilation faster.

data.title: Position in scene picking, fix build issues and GPU format specification issues
Linux & OS X fixes
data.body:
Hi! I'm back.

Here are yet another bunch of fixes on Linux (and OS X!), mostly minor things, I think, except maybe a few methods in allocators.

I'm curious to know if it builds on Windows. (On OS X, StdAlloc::construct(U\* p, Args&&... args) yields a build error.)

Best,
Marc

data.title: Fixed crash when adding light in pivot mode
data.body:
Fixed the crash caused by NaN arithmetics by checking if the SceneObject boundaries are infinite.
If this is the case, its center is taken into account instead.
Added EditorUtility::calculateCenter which replaces AABBox math of calculateBounds with simpler vector sums (since some times we used calculateBounds only for the center).

data.title: InternalErrorException when launching pre-built binaries
data.body:
Running BansheeEditorExec.exe from pre-built binaries results in _InternalErrorException_ when loading library `BansheeD3D11RenderAPI.dll`. I have included the compiled crash report. If I had to guess, the working directory and the relative dependencies path are not playing well together.

Recreation Steps
1. Extract pre-built binaries from Banshee_Win_x64_v0.3.0.zip.
2. Launch BansheeEditorExec.exe

[log.txt](https://github.com/BearishSun/BansheeEngine/files/381532/log.txt)
